name: Hard Macau:  A Long And Colorful History Quiz / Test | History | 10 Questions

questions.text: Macau was a colony of which European country?
questions.explanation:
Portugal.

	The Portuguese established a trading post, which became the midway between Europe and the lucrative Far East markets.

questions.text: When was the first permanent Portuguese settlement established in Macau?
questions.explanation:
1557.

	1492 was Colombus' little jaunt westwards, 1666 was the Great Fire of London and 1755 was the Great Lisbon Earthquake.

questions.text: Macau was the last European colony in Asia.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Portugal officially handed Macau back to Chinese control in December of 1999, making it the last European colony in Asia.

questions.text: The name Macau is derived from what?
options: A species of monkey native to the region
An indigenous plant used in medicine
questions.explanation:
A goddess of sea farers.

	The name derives from A-Ma-Gau harbour, which in itself derives from A-Ma, a goddess of sea farers.

questions.text: Who was once jailed in Macau on charges of malfeasance, while on a governmental post?
questions.explanation:
Luis de Camoes.

	Camoes became Portugal's greatest poet. His book 'Os Lusiadas', the history in verse of the trials and tribulations of his countrymen. The other three were all famous explorers.

questions.text: Macau was given a Portuguese religious name in order to encourage Christianity in the province. What was it?
questions.explanation:
'City of the name of God'.

	The full title was 'Cidade do nome de Deus, de Macau, nao ha outra mais leal', which translates into, 'City of the name of God, there is none more loyal'.

questions.text: Which other European power's constant efforts to take Macau by force, were repelled on each occasion by the inhabitants?
questions.explanation:
Netherlands.

	The successful defence of the territory promted the tag 'There is none more loyal'.

questions.text: The rise to prominence of another port in the region heralded the decline of Macau. Which one was it?
questions.explanation:
Hong Kong.

	With the steady rise in influence of the British in the region, and the fact that Hong Kong had a deep water port, which was much easier for bigger ships to access, Macau's strategic importance began to wane. The two are just 40 miles apart.

questions.text: The Chinese government paid an annual trading fee to the Portuguese for use of the port's facilities.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The Portuguese paid an annual 'ground rent' to the Chinese for the use of Macau as a trading post.

questions.text: After Hong Kong took over as the principal port and trading post of the region, how did Macau's financial fortunes start to rise again?
questions.explanation:
It became a gambling resort.

	The first gambling licences were issued in 1860 by the Portuguese Governor. Macau is a fascinating mixture of east and west, with a colorful history, which hopefully was demonstrated, at least in part, in this quiz.
